00028 /**
00029  * A persistent pool of Applications.
00030  *
00031  * Spawning Ruby on Rails application instances is a very expensive operation.
00032  * Despite best efforts to make the operation less expensive (see SpawnManager),
00033  * it remains expensive compared to the cost of processing an HTTP request/response.
00034  * So, in order to solve this, some sort of caching/pooling mechanism will be required.
00035  * ApplicationPool provides this.
00036  *
00037  * Normally, one would use SpawnManager to spawn a new RoR application instance,
00038  * then use Application::connect() to create a new session with that application
00039  * instance, and then use the returned Session object to send the request and
00040  * to read the HTTP response. ApplicationPool replaces the first step with
00041  * a call to Application::get(). For example:
00042  * @code
00043  *   ApplicationPool pool = some_function_which_creates_an_application_pool();
00044  *   
00045  *   // Connect to the application and get the newly opened session.
00046  *   Application::SessionPtr session(pool->get("/home/webapps/foo"));
00047  *   
00048  *   // Send the request headers and request body data.
00049  *   session->sendHeaders(...);
00050  *   session->sendBodyBlock(...);
00051  *   // Done sending data, so we close the writer channel.
00052  *   session->closeWriter();
00053  *
00054  *   // Now read the HTTP response.
00055  *   string responseData = readAllDataFromSocket(session->getReader());
00056  *   // Done reading data, so we close the reader channel.
00057  *   session->closeReader();
00058  *
00059  *   // This session has now finished, so we close the session by resetting
00060  *   // the smart pointer to NULL (thereby destroying the Session object).
00061  *   session.reset();
00062  *
00063  *   // We can connect to an Application multiple times. Just make sure
00064  *   // the previous session is closed.
00065  *   session = app->connect("/home/webapps/bar")
00066  * @endcode
00067  *
00068  * Internally, Application::get() will keep spawned applications instances in
00069  * memory, and reuse them if possible. It will try to keep spawning to a minimum.
00070  * Furthermore, if an application instance hasn't been used for a while, it
00071  * will be automatically shutdown in order to save memory. And finally, one can
00072  * set a hard limit on the maximum number of applications instances that may be
00073  * spawned (see ApplicationPool::setMax()).
00074  *
00075  * Note that ApplicationPool is just an interface (i.e. a pure virtual class).
00076  * For concrete classes, see StandardApplicationPool and ApplicationPoolServer.
00077  *
00078  * @ingroup Support
00079  */
00080 class ApplicationPool {
00081 public:
00082         virtual ~ApplicationPool() {};
00083         
00084         /**
00085          * Open a new session with the application specified by <tt>appRoot</tt>.
00086          * See the class description for ApplicationPool, as well as Application::connect(),
00087          * on how to use the returned session object.
00088          *
00089          * @param appRoot The application root of a RoR application, i.e. the folder that
00090          *             contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc. This must be a valid
00091          *             directory, but does not have to be an absolute path.
00092          * @param user The user to run the application instance as.
00093          * @param group The group to run the application instance as.
00094          * @return A session object.
00095          * @note Applications are uniquely identified with the application root
00096          *       string. So although <tt>appRoot</tt> does not have to be absolute, it
00097          *       should be. If one calls <tt>get("/home/foo")</tt> and
00098          *       <tt>get("/home/../home/foo")</tt>, then ApplicationPool will think
00099          *       they're 2 different applications, and thus will spawn 2 application instances.
00100          */
00101         virtual Application::SessionPtr get(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") = 0;
00102         
00103         /**
00104          * Set a hard limit on the number of application instances that this ApplicationPool
00105          * may spawn. The exact behavior depends on the used algorithm, and is not specified by
00106          * these API docs.
00107          *
00108          * It is allowed to set a limit lower than the current number of spawned applications.
00109          */
00110         virtual void setMax(unsigned int max) = 0;
00111         
00112         /**
00113          * Get the number of active applications in the pool.
00114          *
00115          * This method exposes an implementation detail of the underlying pooling algorithm.
00116          * It is used by unit tests to verify that the implementation is correct,
00117          * and thus should not be called directly.
00118          */
00119         virtual unsigned int getActive() const = 0;
00120         
00121         /**
00122          * Get the number of active applications in the pool.
00123          *
00124          * This method exposes an implementation detail of the underlying pooling algorithm.
00125          * It is used by unit tests to verify that the implementation is correct,
00126          * and thus should not be called directly.
00127          */
00128         virtual unsigned int getCount() const = 0;
00129 };

00133 /**
00134  * A standard implementation of ApplicationPool for single-process environments.
00135  *
00136  * The environment may or may not be multithreaded - StandardApplicationPool is completely
00137  * thread-safe. Apache with the threading MPM is an example of a multithreaded single-process
00138  * environment.
00139  *
00140  * This class is unusable in multi-process environments such as Apache with the prefork MPM.
00141  * The reasons as as follows:
00142  *  - StandardApplicationPool uses threads internally. Because threads disappear after a fork(),
00143  *    a StandardApplicationPool object will become unusable after a fork().
00144  *  - StandardApplicationPool stores its internal cache on the heap. Different processes
00145  *    cannot share their heaps, so they will not be able to access each others' pool cache.
00146  *  - StandardApplicationPool has a connection to the spawn server. If there are multiple
00147  *    processes, and they all use the spawn servers's connection at the same time without
00148  *    some sort of synchronization, then bad things will happen.
00149  *
00150  * (Of course, StandardApplicationPool <em>is</em> usable if each process creates its own
00151  * StandardApplicationPool object, but that would defeat the point of having a shared pool.)
00152  *
00153  * For multi-process environments, one should use ApplicationPoolServer instead.
00154  *
00155  * @ingroup Support
00156  */
00157 class StandardApplicationPool: public ApplicationPool {
00158 private:
00159         static const int CLEAN_INTERVAL = 62;
00160         static const int MAX_IDLE_TIME = 60;
00161 
00162         friend class ApplicationPoolServer;
00163 
00164         typedef list<ApplicationPtr> ApplicationList;
00165         typedef shared_ptr<ApplicationList> ApplicationListPtr;
00166         typedef map<string, ApplicationListPtr> ApplicationMap;
00167         
00168         struct SharedData {
00169                 mutex lock;
00170                 condition countOrMaxChanged;
00171                 
00172                 ApplicationMap apps;
00173                 unsigned int max;
00174                 unsigned int count;
00175                 unsigned int active;
00176         };
00177         
00178         typedef shared_ptr<SharedData> SharedDataPtr;
00179         
00180         struct SessionCloseCallback {
00181                 SharedDataPtr data;
00182                 weak_ptr<Application> app;
00183                 
00184                 SessionCloseCallback(SharedDataPtr data, weak_ptr<Application> app) {
00185                         this->data = data;
00186                         this->app = app;
00187                 }
00188                 
00189                 void operator()(Application::Session &session) {
00190                         mutex::scoped_lock l(data->lock);
00191                         ApplicationPtr app(this->app.lock());
00192                         
00193                         if (app != NULL) {
00194                                 ApplicationMap::iterator it(data->apps.find(app->getAppRoot()));
00195                                 if (it != data->apps.end()) {
00196                                         if (app->getSessions() == 0) {
00197                                                 // TODO: make this operation constant time
00198                                                 it->second->remove(app);
00199                                                 it->second->push_front(app);
00200                                         }
00201                                         data->active--;
00202                                 }
00203                                 app->setLastUsed(time(NULL));
00204                         }
00205                 }
00206         };

00208         #ifdef PASSENGER_USE_DUMMY_SPAWN_MANAGER
00209                 DummySpawnManager spawnManager;
00210         #else
00211                 SpawnManager spawnManager;
00212         #endif
00213         SharedDataPtr data;
00214         thread *cleanerThread;
00215         bool detached;
00216         bool done;
00217         condition cleanerThreadSleeper;
00218         
00219         mutex &lock;
00220         condition &countOrMaxChanged;
00221         ApplicationMap &apps;
00222         unsigned int &max;
00223         unsigned int &count;
00224         unsigned int &active;
00225         
00226         bool needsRestart(const string &appRoot) const {
00227                 return false;
00228         }
00229         
00230         void cleanerThreadMainLoop() {
00231                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00232                 while (!done) {
00233                         xtime xt;
00234                         xtime_get(&xt, TIME_UTC);
00235                         xt.sec += CLEAN_INTERVAL;
00236                         cleanerThreadSleeper.timed_wait(l, xt);
00237                         if (done) {
00238                                 break;
00239                         }
00240                         
00241                         ApplicationMap::iterator appsIter;
00242                         time_t now = time(NULL);
00243                         for (appsIter = apps.begin(); appsIter != apps.end(); appsIter++) {
00244                                 ApplicationList &appList(*appsIter->second);
00245                                 ApplicationList::iterator listIter;
00246                                 list<ApplicationList::iterator> elementsToRemove;
00247                                 
00248                                 for (listIter = appList.begin(); listIter != appList.end(); listIter++) {
00249                                         Application &app(**listIter);
00250                                         if (now - app.getLastUsed() > MAX_IDLE_TIME) {
00251                                                 P_TRACE("Cleaning idle app " << app.getAppRoot());
00252                                                 elementsToRemove.push_back(listIter);
00253                                         }
00254                                 }
00255                                 
00256                                 list<ApplicationList::iterator>::iterator it;
00257                                 for (it = elementsToRemove.begin(); it != elementsToRemove.end(); it++) {
00258                                         appList.erase(*it);
00259                                 }
00260                         }
00261                 }
00262         }
00263         
00264         void detach() {
00265                 detached = true;
00266         }
00267         
00268 public:
00269         /**
00270          * Create a new StandardApplicationPool object.
00271          *
00272          * @param spawnServerCommand The filename of the spawn server to use.
00273          * @param logFile Specify a log file that the spawn server should use.
00274          *            Messages on its standard output and standard error channels
00275          *            will be written to this log file. If an empty string is
00276          *            specified, no log file will be used, and the spawn server
00277          *            will use the same standard output/error channels as the
00278          *            current process.
00279          * @param environment The RAILS_ENV environment that all RoR applications
00280          *            should use. If an empty string is specified, the current value
00281          *            of the RAILS_ENV environment variable will be used.
00282          * @param rubyCommand The Ruby interpreter's command.
00283          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00284          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00285          */
00286         StandardApplicationPool(const string &spawnServerCommand,
00287                      const string &logFile = "",
00288                      const string &environment = "production",
00289                      const string &rubyCommand = "ruby")
00290                 :
00291                 #ifndef PASSENGER_USE_DUMMY_SPAWN_MANAGER
00292                 spawnManager(spawnServerCommand, logFile, environment, rubyCommand),
00293                 #endif
00294                 data(new SharedData()),
00295                 lock(data->lock),
00296                 countOrMaxChanged(data->countOrMaxChanged),
00297                 apps(data->apps),
00298                 max(data->max),
00299                 count(data->count),
00300                 active(data->active)
00301         {
00302                 detached = false;
00303                 done = false;
00304                 max = 100;
00305                 count = 0;
00306                 active = 0;
00307                 cleanerThread = new thread(bind(&StandardApplicationPool::cleanerThreadMainLoop, this));
00308         }
00309         
00310         virtual ~StandardApplicationPool() {
00311                 if (!detached) {
00312                         {
00313                                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00314                                 done = true;
00315                                 cleanerThreadSleeper.notify_one();
00316                         }
00317                         cleanerThread->join();
00318                 }
00319                 delete cleanerThread;
00320         }
00321         
00322         virtual Application::SessionPtr
00323         get(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") {
00324                 /*
00325                  * See "doc/ApplicationPool Algorithm.txt" for a more readable description
00326                  * of the algorithm.
00327                  */
00328                 ApplicationPtr app;
00329                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00330                 
00331                 if (needsRestart(appRoot)) {
00332                         apps.erase(appRoot);
00333                 }
00334                 
00335                 ApplicationMap::iterator it(apps.find(appRoot));
00336                 if (it != apps.end()) {
00337                         ApplicationList &appList(*it->second);
00338                 
00339                         if (appList.front()->getSessions() == 0) {
00340                                 app = appList.front();
00341                                 appList.pop_front();
00342                                 appList.push_back(app);
00343                                 active++;
00344                         } else if (count < max) {
00345                                 app = spawnManager.spawn(appRoot, user, group);
00346                                 appList.push_back(app);
00347                                 count++;
00348                                 countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00349                                 active++;
00350                         } else {
00351                                 app = appList.front();
00352                                 appList.pop_front();
00353                                 appList.push_back(app);
00354                                 active++;
00355                         }
00356                 } else {
00357                         while (count >= max) {
00358                                 countOrMaxChanged.wait(l);
00359                         }
00360                         app = spawnManager.spawn(appRoot, user, group);
00361                         ApplicationListPtr appList(new ApplicationList());
00362                         appList->push_back(app);
00363                         apps[appRoot] = appList;
00364                         count++;
00365                         countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00366                         active++;
00367                 }
00368                 app->setLastUsed(time(NULL));
00369                 return app->connect(SessionCloseCallback(data, app));
00370         }
00371         
00372         virtual void setMax(unsigned int max) {
00373                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00374                 this->max = max;
00375                 countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00376         }
00377         
00378         virtual unsigned int getActive() const {
00379                 return active;
00380         }
00381         
00382         virtual unsigned int getCount() const {
00383                 return count;
00384         }
00385 };
